ext_descriptions.ext_description: A mounting_technology_type lists the type of the mounting technology.
specifies that component is surface mount;
specifies that component is through hole;
A predefined_lead_form lists the predefined forms of the lead.
specifies that predefined from of the lead is gull wing;
specifies that predefined from of the lead is j lead;
specifies that predefined from of the lead is reversed j lead;
specifies that predefined from of the lead is integral terminal;
specifies that predefined from of the lead is undefined;
specifies that predefined from of the lead is ball;
specifies that predefined from of the lead is straight;
A seating_plane_intersection_type lists the types of the intersection.
specifies that intersection types is surface;
specifies that intersection types is through;
specifies that seating plane does not intersect;

A Connection_zone_package_interface_plane_relationship is a mean to establish a product structure relationship that may be represented in a geometric context for the purpose of deriving a 2D or 3D representation of the intersection of a terminal interface.
an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the is dependent on the the existence of the that specifies the as its . There shall be no more than one for a .
specifies the text that describes the .
specifies the role of a for the .
specifies the role of a for the .
specifies the role of a for the .
The combination of interface_plane and mating_zone shall be unique within a population of .
derived_zone_shape_class will be 'area' or 'edge'.
A Guided_wave_terminal is a type of that is explicitly included for the purpose of providing access to the functionality of a using guided waves.

ext_description.p: A Package is a type of a . A Package may be a . A Package describes the physical container of a . A Package includes no more than one package body and one or more package terminals.
ext_description.example: Figures 1 through 2 illustrate types of Packages and parameters related to Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing supported by this part of ISO 10303. ISO 10303-202 would be used in conjunction with this part of ISO 10303 to define the exchange of the presentation information (i.e., the drawings). This part of ISO 10303 supports the direct application to application exchange of the parametric data illustrated in the drawings.

Figures 3 through 4 illustrate parameters and features related to Package orientation for assembly purposes supported by this part of ISO 10303. ISO 10303-202 would be used in conjunction with this part of ISO 10303 to define the exchange of the presentation information (i.e., the drawings).
ext_description.note: When used for a "white box model", the is installed in the Package and an electrical connection is defined between each terminal on the installed and one or more terminals on the Package.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.
an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Package as its .
an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.
an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.
an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.
an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be zero or more for a Package.

ext_description.p: an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . The simulates the interface surface of an external device. There may be more than one in the role of interface_plane.
ext_description.note: The interface_plane is typically used for connectors, but may be used for modules.
ext_description.example: A use of interface_plane is in the case of a fiber-optic transceiver that is mounted on a PCB but has a right angle connector to interface with a fiber.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . The simulates the mounting surface for the terminals in the case of surface mounted parts and in the case of through-hole technology, an arbitrarily established mounting surface. Terminals are required to approach the from the top, which is the side where the values on the Z axis are positive. Package installation is defined to be only from the top of the in order to reduce orientation errors between two-dimensional and three-dimensional models in this part of ISO 10303.
an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package.
specifies the sum of maximum_body_height_above_seating_plane and maximum_seating_plane_installation_offset.

specifies a derived value of TRUE or FALSE, depending on the existence of the optional attribute maximum_body_height_below_seating_plane. If the attribute exists, the value is TRUE. If the attribute is no present, the value is FALSE.

specifies maximum package vertical extent, that is a maximum of sum of maximum_body_height_above_seating_plane and maximum_body_height_below_seating_plane, and sum of maximum_body_height_above_seating_plane and maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane.
specifies the smallest lead length below the seating plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum lead length below the seating plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a that is the minimum length between the body and the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a that is the minimum length between the body and the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a that is the maximum length between the body and the bottom of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a that is the maximum length between the body and the top of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum height of the Package below the seating plane. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the maximum height of the Package above the seating plane. Since there is no attribute describing the maximum terminal height above the seating plane, this attribute shall be interpreted as the furthest point away from the seating plane of either the body or of any above the seating plane.
ext_description.example: In the case of package to be mounted in a cutout there may only be the surface mounted leads protruding above the seating plane.

ext_description.p: specifies the nominal mounting span of the Package. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the nominal mounting pitch of the Package. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the form of the surface mount lead of the Package. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum offset of the seating plane installation of the Package. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a value of surface_mount or through_hole for the Package. Surface_mount indicates that the Package_terminals have a that is congruent with the package_seating_plane and through_hole indicates the terminals penetrate the package_seating_plane.
Only a shall be in the role of package_primary_orientation_feature.
Only a shall be in the role of package_secondary_orientation_feature.
Only a shall be in the role of package_tertiary_orientation_feature.
package_seating_plane shall be a .
interface_plane shall be a .
If mounting_technology is , then maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane and least_lead_length_below_seating_plane shall not be provided.
If maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane is provided, then of maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane shall be greater than zero.
If least_lead_length_below_seating_plane is provided, then of least_lead_length_below_seating_plane shall be greater than zero.
surface_mount_lead_form shall be provided only if mounting_technology is .
of package_seating_plane shall be 'package seating plane'.
The element_names of members of interface_plane shall be 'interface plane'.
package_seating_plane shall not be member of interface_plane.
The refered by of shall be assigned by to at least one with 'package'.
There shall be one in package_accesses.
surface_mount_lead_form or shall be provided but not both.

ext_description.note: The text is out of date (rule descriptions)
ext_description.p: A Package_body is a type of that is the encasement used in the realization of a . The observer view shall be above the seating plane and shall be higher than the highest point of the Package_body.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Package_body.
specifies the used in the manufacture of the Package_body.
There shall be no more than one refering Package_body as .
There shall be no more than one refering Package_body as .
There shall be no more than one refering Package_body as .
A Package_body_bottom_surface is a type of that is not visible from an observer located so as to place the component on a substrate.
A Package_body_edge_segment_surface is a type of .
specifies the for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.
specifies the for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.
specifies the for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.
start_vertex shall not be end_vertex.
A Package_body_edge_surface is a type of .

A Package_body_surface is a type of . A Package_body_surface may be one of a , a , a , or a . A Package_body_surface relationship to the seating plane may be explicitly established, helping to unambiguously orient the .
specifies the role of the for the Package_body_surface.
A Package_body_top_surface is a type of that is visible from any observer located so as to place the component on a substrate.

ext_description.p: A Package_terminal is a type of . A Package_terminal may be one or more of a , a , a , or a . When the case or package body is used as a terminal then Package_terminal shall be populated to specify the feature of the that serves that purpose. The Package_terminal shall be in a sequence, with the initial member being , and each member that is not a shall reference a previous member in the sequence using the attribute inherited from . The seating_plane_zone shall not exist if the seating_plane_intersection attribute is 'does not intersect'. The seating_plane_intersection attribute shall not be 'does not intersect' if the seating_plane_zone attribute exists.
ext_description.note: The referenced indirectly by this terminal may be in the role of for the referenced by associated_definition.
ext_description.example: Figure 5 illustrates a cutaway view of a terminal and shows the characteristics related to a terminal.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal. There shall be one or more Feature_shape_occurrence for the Package_terminal.
an attribute's value becomes TRUE only then seating_plane_zone exists and it's is of associated_definition.

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Package_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that represents the maximum allowed diameter of a Package_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The is the diameter of a circle that circumscribes the cross-sectional shape of the terminal.

specifies the that represents the minimum allowed diameter of a Package_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The is the diameter of a circle that circumscribes the cross-sectional shape of the terminal.
specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal core material. The terminal_core_material is optional and need not be supplied.
specifies the of the Package_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. There may be more than one for a Package_terminal.
specifies the role of the for the outer surface of the Package_terminal surface material.

ext_description.p: specifies whether or not the shape of the Package_terminal intersects the shape of the seating plane to within the tolerance of the geometric context. The values allowed for the attribute are 'surface_intersection', 'through_intersection', 'does_not_intersect'.
ext_description.note: Not all terminals need to intersect the seating plane.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the on the inside portion of the Package_terminal. There may be more than one in the role of internal_connection_zone. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the on the outside surface of the Package_terminal. There may be more than one for a Package_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the source system contains the data, then the external_connection_zone shall be supplied.
ext_description.note: The specified by the terminal or mounting feature may be the same Feature_shape_occurrence that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal.
If seating_plane_zone is provided, then it's shall be in external_connection_zone.
If seating_plane_zone is provided, then it's shall be in external_connection_zone.
If seating_plane_zone is provided, then it's shall be either , or of associated_definition.
If seating_plane_zone is provided, then seating_plane_intersection shall be or .
If seating_plane_zone is provided, then seating_plane_intersection shall not be .
The inherited from shall be the for all members of external_connection_zone.
The inherited from shall be the for all members of internal_connection_zone.
A Package_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship is a type of . It associates the surface of the package to a terminal via .
an instance specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship.
an instance specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Primary_reference_terminal is a type of . This terminal is assigned the identifier string that is first in the sequence of package terminal names to be assigned to the part. The Primary_reference_terminal shall not specify a and is the first member of the sequence of . The sort order of the names assigned to the Packaged_terminals is defined by the explicit sequence established by the use of inherited from .
ext_description.example: If a value of '1' is available, assigning a value of '2' to this terminal would be prohibited by this part of ISO 10303, due to the possibility of confusion.
ext_description.note: The Primary_reference_terminal is often associated with an orientation feature, but it may not be the orientation feature itself. Usually the Primary_reference_terminal and the are different part_features.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The inherited from shall not be provided for a Primary_reference_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Functional_orientation_feature is a type of . A Functional_orientation_feature provides visible or tactile means to reduce or eliminate ambiguity of the location of a in an assembly operation.
ext_description.note: Other orientation information may be required in addition to the Functional_orientation_feature to totally disambiguate the correct orientation.
ext_description.example: A mark on a component implemented with ink or a visible indentation or a formed corner may be used to indicate the fact that pin one of the package is in close proximity to the mark. A vision system or a human operator will use the mark to correctly orient the component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the for the Functional_orientation_feature.
specifies the for the Functional_orientation_feature. There shall be one or two package_body_surfaces for a Functional_orientation_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Polarity_indication_feature is a type of . A Polarity_indication_feature provides visible or tactile means to reduce or eliminate ambiguity of the location of a polarized part in an assembly operation. A Polarity_indication_feature shall not be used to identify orientation features of non-polarized components.
ext_description.note: Other orientation information may be required in addition to the Polarity_indication_feature to totally disambiguate the correct orientation.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the for the polarity indication feature.
specifies a set of for the polarity indication feature. There may be one or two for the Polarity_indication_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Primary_orientation_feature is a type of and is a type of . A Primary_orientation_feature participates in providing for the unambiguos orientation of a part on its next assembly.
ext_description.note: A Primary_orientation_feature is not necessarily also a .
ext_description.example: Figure 6 illustrates two of the three-dimensional geometric relationships between a component and the printed circuit board it is mounted on. A datum system is included for reference purposes. The Z direction is parallel to the normal of the top surface of the board. Both the top and bottom surface normal vectors are parallel to the normal vectors of the seating plane for the components.
Figure 7 illustrates two of the two-dimensional geometric relationships between a component and the printed circuit board it is mounted on. A datum system is included for reference purposes.
Figures 8 through 9 illustrates orientation details for microcircuit packages.

Figure 10 illustrates details associated with several variations of an Axial package modification and the associated . In all these cases, the seating plane orientation with respect to the is constant, while the shape orientation changes due to the modification.

Figure 11 illustrates assignment and also assignment of . Knowledge of Polarity_indication_features separate from the orientation feature increases the ability to determine when to use polarity indication symbols on the interconnect substrate for polarized components e.g., polarized capacitors, diodes).

figure.title: Eight lead gull wing orientation features

ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Secondary_orientation_feature is a type of that is both: a and a . A Secondary_orientation_feature provides anti-rotation capability for unambiguous orientation of the part in the datum reference frame.

an associated_body_vertical_extent specifies the role of the for a Secondary_orientation_feature. The associated_body_vertical_extent helps to identify the surface or surfaces which contain the feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Tertiary_orientation_feature is a type of that is both: a and a . A Tertiary_orientation_feature provides anti-rotation capability for unambiguous orientation of the part in the datum reference frame.

an associated_body_vertical_extent specifies the role of the for a Tertiary_orientation_feature. The associated_body_vertical_extent helps to identify the surface or surfaces which contain the feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Wire_terminal is a type of a whose is inherently flexible and ready for installation to a without prior formal preparation by shape modification. The shape of the Wire_terminal is incompletely defined in the library.
The inherited by the terminal may be the same Feature_shape_occurrence that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .
specifies the for the minimum length of the Wire_terminal.
specifies the for the maximum length of the Wire_terminal.

specifies the role of a for the Wire_terminal. There shall be one or more for the Wire_terminal. The internal_connection_zone is mandatory because it locates the end of the wire that is the attachment area on the package body.
A Package_orientation_feature is a type of or .
specifies a role of the for the Package_orientation_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
